statementSentences.sentence: Hippocrates stated: "it is more important to know what person the disease has than what disease the person has".
Each individual presents unique issues that require tailored, collaborative treatment.
A practicing physician for over twenty years, I have dedicated my life to helping individuals balance their mental and physical well-being.
My practice and Integrative Center for Wellness focus on incorporating psychiatric treatments with nutritional therapies to calibrate balance between mind and body.

With expertise in bipolar disorder, depression, anxiety, ADHD, stuttering and weight management, among others, treatment modalities include psychotherapy, medication, exercise, wellness and nutrition counseling.
Anxiety, depression, bipolar disorder, overeating, stress and many other issues result from a combination of biological and environmental factors.

Careful, thorough evaluation and a holistic approach -- knowing the person at the core, individualizing treatment, and integrating behavioral, psychiatric and nutritional modalities - are critical to successful management of many diagnoses.
Mental disorders are associated with significant stigma.
I help patients decipher myth from the facts and how best to deal with them.
I formulate a comprehensive treatment addressing concerns about medications, dependence, and long-term effects.
For more information, please visit www.samoonmd.com.

statementSentences.sentence: I am a licensed psychotherapist specializing in the treatment of depression, anxiety, eating disorders, trauma and addiction as well as relationship and family conflicts.

I would be happy to arrange a consultation with you at either of my locations and look forward to helping you create meaningful and fulfilling life changes.

statementSentences.sentence: In my clinical practice, I take a predominantly cognitive-behavioral approach and integrate mindfulness and acceptance-based treatments.

I was trained by a world renowned expert utilizing Exposure and Response Prevention techniques.
I also specialize in treating General Anxiety Disorder, Panic Disorder, Phobias, Social Anxiety and mood disorders.
Additionally, my clinical interests include treatments for eating disorders and body image concerns, parenting skills training, as well as relational conflict and interpersonal challenges.
I utilize techniques from Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT) and Dialectical Behavioral Therapy (DBT) to work with those experiencing difficulty regulating emotions.
My research background has primarily focused on Body Dysmorphic Disorder and other body image distortions.

statementSentences.sentence: My goal is to help you understand and manage the challenges you are facing through an exploration of root causes and the development of healthy thoughts and effective coping mechanisms.
Certain experiences, relationships, or circumstances may bring about feelings of sadness, anxiety, loneliness, anger, low self esteem, shame, and guilt.
Together we can identify triggers and beliefs that contribute to your troubling thoughts, emotions, and behaviors, with the goal of increased self understanding and less emotional distress.
I am deeply committed to helping you understand how your feelings, thoughts, and experiences impact your perceptions of your life, self, and relationships.
It is important to me that therapy be a collaborative and open process.
I will provide a safe, supportive environment within which we can work together to help you feel and get better.
Additionally, I specialize in LGBTQ-related concerns; all gender identities, gender expressions, and sexualities are welcome.
Please note that we are not an "in-network provider," even though we work out of network with companies such as Aetna, Cigna, and United.
We will check your benefits, file your claims, have the insurance company send the funds directly to us so you only pay a co-pay.

I have worked in counseling & psychotherapy for over 25 years and if you would like me to help, feel free to call.

highlights.sentence: "I am an experienced psychotherapist offering support to individuals of any race, cultural background, or sexual orientation through social, spiritual, and psychological challenges."

Therapy is most essentially a partnership between collaborators communicating clearly, specifically, and honestly.

Your only qualification is honesty.
Powerful social forces of class, gender, religion, and family shape us in interaction with each other and our own dispositions.

statementSentences.sentence: Psychotherapy can be challenging, but it is a rewarding process.
